    • fundsr: Rolling differences and Xetra liquidity plots

Plot rolling return differences against benchmark

Source: R/plots.R
rcd_plot.Rd

Creates a scatter plot of rolling CAGR or log-return differences for the selected funds, including quantile-based y-limits, optional title additions, and customizable ggplot parameters.

rcd_plot(
  data,
  n_days,
  funds,
  use_log = FALSE,
  gg_params = NULL,
  title_add = NULL,
  date_brk = NULL,
  qprob = c(0.005, 0.995)
)

Arguments

data

Input data frame containing dates and rolling-difference columns.

n_days

Window length (in days) used to compute rolling differences.

funds

Character vector of fund tickers to include.

use_log

Logical; if TRUE, use log-return differences instead of CAGR.

gg_params

Optional list of additional ggplot layers or modifications.

title_add

Optional string appended to the title.

date_brk

Optional date-break specification for the x-axis; computed automatically if omitted.

qprob

Two-element numeric vector giving lower and upper quantiles used to set the y-axis limits.

Value

A ggplot object.

Details

The function reshapes input data into long format, computes quantile-based y-limits, selects appropriate date breaks, and produces a scatter plot of rolling differences coloured by fund. Additional ggplot layers may be added via gg_params.
